channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump’s Shutdown Agenda, and a Wave of Mysterious Drones in Scandinavia
item.description: Plus, what Jane Goodall learned among the chimps.

item.title: Research, curriculum and grading: new data sheds light on how professors are using AI
item.description: It's not just students, more professors are using AI in the classroom. But they say more guidance is needed on how to use the technology.

item.title: From Madagascar to Morocco: Gen Z protests shake Africa
item.description: Gen Z-led protests in two diverse African countries highlight frustration over years of poor governance. Fueled by social media, these youth movements...

item.title: For Workers, Mixed Signals. For the Public, Limited Impact on Shutdown’s First Day.
item.description: Federal agencies gave shifting and mixed guidance to their work forces about who should come to work and who shouldn’t, but the initial effect on serv...

item.title: Furloughs, closures and mass firings threats: What's next in the shutdown fight
item.description: On the first day of the government shutdown, Republicans and Democrats traded blame while a small bipartisan group of senators began to negotiate.

item.title: Air traffic controllers helped end the last government shutdown, and may again
item.description: A shortage of air traffic controllers may have played a role in ending the last government shutdown in 2019. U.S airlines are once again bracing for p...

item.title: Many Palestinians Say Hamas Must Accept U.S. Cease-Fire Plan
item.description: Interviews in Gaza suggest wide support for a proposal that calls for an immediate end to a war that has brought immense civilian suffering.

item.title: In Trump country, a Democrat critiques Trump — and talks of succeeding him
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with Kentucky Governor Andy Beshear about his cross-party appeal in a state that has always overwhelmingly voted for Trump.

item.title: Fed’s Independence in Jeopardy Despite Latest Lisa Cook Victory
item.description: A Supreme Court order keeping Lisa Cook on the Federal Reserve Board for now is “a time to exhale but not breathe easy,” one expert said.

item.title: A Run on Canned Mackerel and Emergency Radios. The Reason? Drones.
item.description: The Danish public has been unsettled by a wave of mysterious drone incursions, which has underscored the country’s vulnerability.

item.title: Many Palestinians Say Hamas Must Accept U.S. Cease-Fire Plan
item.description: Interviews in Gaza suggest wide support for a proposal that calls for an immediate end to a war that has brought immense civilian suffering.

item.title: A Run on Canned Mackerel and Emergency Radios. The Reason? Drones.
item.description: The Danish public has been unsettled by a wave of mysterious drone incursions, which has underscored the country’s vulnerability.

item.title: Philippines President Says Tents Needed to Shelter Earthquake Survivors
item.description: Officials were optimistic on Thursday that most of the missing had been accounted for. But severe damage to the area means many people lack shelter, w...

item.title: 4 People Injured After Stabbing Outside Manchester Synagogue, UK Police Say
item.description: The stabbing in Manchester, England, came on Yom Kippur, the holiest day in the Jewish calendar.

item.title: Madagascar’s President Rajoelina Dissolved His Government, but Calls for His Resignation Continue
item.description: A growing protest movement on the African island, despite deadly clashes with security forces, vows to keep fighting until Andry Rajoelina is ousted.
